page.title: 13Fisher Interview:continued.
page.content: Many older houses have been modernised and new ones have been built much closer together with less space for gardens and as a result the 'feel' of the village has changed dramatically. Mr.Fisher likes the village because it is central in Norfolk,but admits that he has known no other village well. His chief dislikes are litter and dirty dogs (and their owners). The shops have changed a good deal: ten years ago there were only seven, now there are fourteen.The shops are now mainly self-service,whereas there used to be assistants. He would like to see no changes except a more caring attitude to the village from its inhabitants,in particular where tidiness is concerned. His favourite place in the village is his home,and he likes his job.
